intro: Psychotria hombroniana var. ladronica, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its striking red flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant contains alkaloids, making it of interest to both botanists and ethnobotologists.
